note: Description of manuscript in English laid in.

msIdentifier.repository: Library at the Herbert D. Katz Center for Advanced Judaic Studies

msContents.summary: Two prayers copied in the same hand and bound together. The first is a short prayer to follow the Gospel of John in the morning and the second is the complete midnight prayers.

title: Subḥat al-malāʼikah baʻda Injīl Yūḥannā fī ṣalāt bākir. Ṣalāt niṣf al-layl.

title.#text: سبحة الملائكة بعد انجيل يوحنا في صلاة باكر. صلاة نصف الليل

persName.#text: Rashīdī, Rizq ibn Yūsuf ibn Ḥannā, active 1836
رشيدي، رزق بن يوسف بن حنا،

name.#text: Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning

msItem.title: Subḥat al-malāʼikah baʻda Injīl Yūḥannā fī ṣalāt bākir

supportDesc.extent: i, 41 leaves : 163 x 110 (105 x 90) mm bound to 163 x 110 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Coptic numeral foliation, upper left verso, each work foliated seperately (i, 1-6, 1-32, ii) catchwords every verso, lower left. Arabic numeral foliation added in pencil, upper left recto. References in the record are to the Arabic foliation.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 16 lines in two columns, a wider column (65 mm) for Coptic on the left and a narrower column (25 mm) on the right for Arabic.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in Coptic with Arabic in naskh in black ink; pointed.

decoNote: Headpieces in gray, black and faded red (f. 1r, 8r); decorated initials and rubrications in faded red and gray.

binding.p: Bound as a pamphlet in gray paper that is slightly too narrow for the textblock.

origin.p: Copied by Rizq Ibn Yūsuf ibn Ḥannā, from Egypt, in the 19th century (f. 40v).

provenance: Gift of Cyrus Adler to the library of the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (note on library bookplate, inside front cover).
Formerly owned by the Dropsie College for Hebrew and Cognate Learning (library bookplate inside front cover).
